definition: forced labor/corvée (labor required of a serf)/animal labor
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
forced labor/corvée/obligatory task/military service/to use as servant/to enserf/servant (old)/war/campaign/battle

sentences.english: At work, at paying out a cable or winding up a capstan, Jean Valjean was worth four men.
sentences.chinese: 服勞役時，扭鐵索，推絞盤，冉阿讓抵得上四個人。

sentences.english: Richard got a light sentence and was sent to a cherry farm for six months.
sentences.chinese: 理查德判了輕刑，被送到勞改農場服勞役六個月。

sentences.english: "She told me it's going to be a labour of love, " Katz said.
sentences.chinese: 她對我說，這會是愛的勞役。

sentences.english: There they were forced to slave at the most difficult labor.
sentences.chinese: 在流放地，他們被迫從事最繁重的勞役。

sentences.english: One year of service-in exchange for a lifetime with Sabrina.
sentences.chinese: 相形之下，用一年的勞役換來與薩布萊娜廝守終生。

sentences.english: Were it for work and drudgery it would be endlessly long.
sentences.chinese: 如果只爲工作和勞役，生命就會變得無盡的漫長。

sentences.english: Giveme the strength to make my love fruitful inservice.
sentences.chinese: 請賜予我力量，使我的愛在勞役中碩果累累。

definition: to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
to dispatch troops/to send an army/to mobilize forces
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
strict law/cruel punishment/to carry out cruel law rigorously
to relieve sb of his post/to sack/to demote/dismissal/sacking
